snippet: What started as a diplomatic tiff has led to a complication in absentee voting for Venezuelans in Florida.
abstract: Venezuelans living in South Florida now must drive to New Orleans to vote in their country's presidential election after Pres Hugo Chavez closed the Miami Consulate; Chavez's critics say it is part of an effort to disenfranchise Venezuelans living in Florida and nearby states, who lean heavily toward opposition candidate Henrique Capriles Radonski.
lead_paragraph: What started as a diplomatic tiff has led to a complication in absentee voting for Venezuelans in Florida.

headline.seo: Closed Consulate in Miami May Affect Venezuelan Vote
headline.main: A Closed Consulate May Limit Venezuelan Votes in the U.S.
headline.print_headline: A Closed Consulate May Limit Venezuelan Votes in the U.S.
